data.question: What is the role of the tricyanomethanide ion in the synthesis of coordination polymers?
data.answer: The tricyanomethanide ion acts as a trigonal 3-connecting unit in the synthesis of coordination polymers.

data.question: Which metal cations form an isostructural series with tcm?
data.answer: Cr2+, Co2+, Ni2+, Cu2+, Zn2+, Cd2+, Hg2+ form an isostructural series with tcm.

data.question: What unique structural feature does Ag(tcm) possess?
data.answer: Ag(tcm) consists of two-dimensional hexagonal grid networks that are corrugated, allowing two independent nets to interpenetrate and form a composite interwoven 2D sheet.

data.question: What unexpected product was formed during the methanolysis of [B(C6H5)4]-?
data.answer: [B(OMe)4]- was the unexpected product formed during the methanolysis.

data.question: How does the coordination environment of cadmium in Cd(tcm)[B(OMe)4] compare to that in Cd2(bpe)2(NO3)2?
data.answer: Both have a similar cadmium coordination geometry with bidentate chelating ligands and three bridging monodentate ligands in a T-shaped arrangement.

data.question: What is the significance of the hexagonal channels in the structure of Cd(tcm)[B(OMe)4]?
data.answer: The hexagonal channels are significant because they contain solvent-filled channels, which are of interest for applications such as heterogeneous catalysts and molecular sieves.

data.question: What happens to the crystals of Cd(tcm)[B(OMe)4] upon exposure to the atmosphere?
data.answer: The crystals degenerate by solvent loss upon exposure to the atmosphere.

data.question: Why might the small bite angle of the [B(OMe)4]- ligands be beneficial in the structure of Cd(tcm)[B(OMe)4]?
data.answer: The small bite angle of the [B(OMe)4]- ligands aids in achieving a high coordination number for the cadmium atom.

data.question: How does the presence of [B(OMe)4]- influence the structure of coordination polymers?
data.answer: [B(OMe)4]- ligands bridge two cadmium atoms and chelate each metal in a bidentate fashion, influencing the formation of a three-dimensional coordination polymer.

data.question: What is the relationship between the helical structure of the Cd-borate and the methanol chain within the channels?
data.answer: Both the Cd-borate helix and the methanol chain inside the channels have the same right-handedness and require the same distance along their common axis for one complete turn.

data.question: How does the topology of the 3D network in Cd(tcm)[B(OMe)4] differ from that of La[B(OMe)4](NO3)2(CH3OH)2?
data.answer: While La[B(OMe)4](NO3)2(CH3OH)2 forms a 1D polymer, Cd(tcm)[B(OMe)4] forms a 3D polymer, showcasing a different type of connectivity and structural complexity.

data.question: What role does the tcm ligand play in the structure of Cd(tcm)[B(OMe)4]?
data.answer: The tcm ligands act as glue, connecting the cadmium-borate helices and defining the channels within the structure.

data.question: Is the structure of Cd(tcm)[B(OMe)4] chiral?
data.answer: True

data.question: Does the structure of Cd(tcm)[B(OMe)4] contain two-dimensional networks?
data.answer: False

data.question: Are all tcm ligands in Cd(tcm)[B(OMe)4] equivalent?
data.answer: True

data.question: Is the methanol in the channels of Cd(tcm)[B(OMe)4] 100% occupied?
data.answer: False

data.question: Does every cadmium node connect to two other cadmium nodes through borate bridges in Cd(tcm)[B(OMe)4]?
data.answer: True

data.question: Is the cadmium coordination environment in Cd(tcm)[B(OMe)4] identical to that in La[B(OMe)4](NO3)2(CH3OH)2?
data.answer: False

data.question: Are the hexagonal channels in Cd(tcm)[B(OMe)4] filled with a solvent other than methanol?
data.answer: False

data.question: Is the presence of [B(OMe)4]- in the structure of Cd(tcm)[B(OMe)4] accidental?
data.answer: True
